1.content: He that keepeth the law, multiplieth offerings.

2.content: It is a wholesome sacrifice to take heed to the commandments, and to depart from all iniquity.

3.content: And to depart from injustice, is to offer a propitiatory sacrifice for injustices, and a begging of pardon for sins.

4.content: He shall return thanks, that offereth fine flour: and he that doth mercy, offereth sacrifice.

5.content: To depart from iniquity is that which pleaseth the Lord, and to depart from injustice, is an entreaty for sins.

6.content: Thou shalt not appear empty in the sight of the Lord.

7.content: For all these things are to be done because of the commandment of God.

8.content: The oblation of the just maketh the altar fat, and is an odour of sweetness in the sight of the most High.

9.content: The sacrifice of the just is acceptable, and the Lord will not forget the memorial thereof.

10.content: Give glory to God with a good heart: and diminish not the firstfruits of thy hands.

11.content: In every gift shew a cheerful countenance, and sanctify thy tithes with joy.

12.content: Give to the most High according to what he hath given to thee, and with a good eye do according to the ability of thy hands:

13.content: For the Lord maketh recompense, and will give thee seven times as much.

14.content: Do not offer wicked gifts, for such he will not receive.

15.content: And look not upon an unjust sacrifice, for the Lord is judge, and there is not with him respect of person.

16.content: The Lord will not accept any person against a poor man, and he will hear the prayer of him that is wronged.

17.content: He will not despise the prayers of the fatherless: nor the widow, when she poureth out her complaint.

18.content: Do not the widow's tears run down the cheek, and her cry against him that causeth them to fall?

19.content: For from the cheek they go up even to heaven, and the Lord that heareth will not be delighted with them.

20.content: He that adoreth God with joy, shall be accepted, and his prayer shall approach even to the clouds.

21.content: The prayer of him that humbleth himself, shall pierce the clouds: and till it come nigh he will not be comforted: and he will not depart till the most High behold.

22.content: And the Lord will not be slack, but will judge for the just, and will do judgment: and the Almighty will not have patience with them, that he may crush their back:

23.content: And he will repay vengeance to the Gentiles, till he have taken away the multitude of the proud, and broken the sceptres of the unjust,

24.content: Till he have rendered to men according to their deeds: and according to the works of Adam, and according to his presumption,

25.content: Till he have judged the cause of his people, and he shall delight the just with his mercy.

26.content: The mercy of God is beautiful in the time of affliction, as a cloud of rain in the time of drought.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
